you can leave here just:

```self.param('kernel_params')``` without the `if`

comments.body:
Hmm, in order to not break backward compatibility we need to set force_migrate to false if not specified:

```
vm_service.migrate(
    host=otypes.Host(name=vm_host), 
    force=self.param('force_migrate')
        if self.param('force_migrate') is not None
        else False,
)
```
Please ignore, the param will be set to False when not specified

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +1380,1384 @@                if vm_host != current_vm_host:
                    if not self._module.check_mode:
                        vm_service.migrate(host=otypes.Host(name=vm_host), force=self.param('force_migrate'))
                        self._wait_for_UP(vm_service)
                    self.changed = True

comments.body: It's too hacky, can we add wait param to this method and override the global wait?
